meanings.sent1: I will republish my book next year.
meanings.sent2: The author decided to republish her novel with a new cover.
meanings.sent3: After losing the original copy, she had to republish the article.
meanings.sent4: The magazine will republish the popular interview in the next issue.
meanings.sent5: He chose to republish the poem to share it with a wider audience.

meanings.definition: To make a previously published work available again.
meanings.sent1: The company plans to republish the classic novel in a special edition.
meanings.sent2: The publisher will republish the out-of-print book for its anniversary.
meanings.sent3: She had to republish the research paper after it was accidentally deleted.
meanings.sent4: The author's decision to republish the series delighted fans.
meanings.sent5: They will republish the magazine article in the online archive.

meanings.definition: To issue a publication for the second or more times.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper will republish the article in tomorrow's edition.
meanings.sent2: The author's decision to republish the book brought it back into the spotlight.
meanings.sent3: He had to republish the newsletter due to a printing error.
meanings.sent4: The magazine will republish the special edition for its anniversary.
meanings.sent5: She chose to republish the cookbook with updated recipes.
